p.s: The Dramadrama A Raisin in the Sun was written by Lorraine Hansberry and was published in 1959.
It is about an African-American family living in the 1950's1950s at Southside Chicago during the time of segregation and discrimination against black people.
When MamasMama's husband dies the family receives 10000$ of insurance money and need to decide what to do with it, but the dreams are different form person to person.
The given szenescene is a part of the first act which illustrates the introduction of the Dramadrama.
After Ruth, Mama, Walter and Travis wake up in their small flat that shares a bathroom with another family Walter breakfasts and talks to his wife Ruth after Travis went to school.
While Ruth is cooking eggs for him Walter opens up about his job and buisnessbusiness plans he made with his friends.
First he tells that he is tired of his normal job and the way they live and that they he wants more than what they have.
He presents his idea of opening a liquor store with the paycheck and wants Ruth to convince Mama to use the money this way.
He gets angry that she doesn't support his dream but she just answers by telling him to eat his eggs.
After this conversation he leaves for work and the other family members get ready too.
